results.title: Ubu
results.creator_credit: Geoff Dunbar, Arts Council of Great Britain and Grand Slamm Animation
results.brief_description: Ubu Roi was written by Alfred Jarry as a schoolboy in 1888. It’s first public performance was in 1896 and it immediately gained the notoriety that it continues to enjoy. The bare bones of the story are those of ‘Macbeth’. For this animated version, Geoff Dunbar has invented a brutal graphic style and ‘language’ of sounds to re-create the explosive impact of Jerry’s original production. Animated by Geoff Dunbar, Annabel Jankel, Ian Lewis, Ginger Gibbons and assisted by Tony Barnes and Gail Wright. Based on the play ‘Ubu Roi’ by Alfred Jarry.

results.title: Twenty-four hours in Czechoslovakia
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Hockey star Stan Mikita of the Chicago Black Hawks visits his native Czechoslovakia for a family reunion. During the course of a day and an evening the film accompanies him, his Chicago-born wife, and their daughter to places familiar to him in Prague and in the little village of Sokolce where he was born. There are many glimpses of the life of the Czech people at work, at home and at leisure. Their enthusiasm for hockey is evident throughout the film, especially when Mikita works out with a Czech team.

results.title: Twentieth century slavery
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, National Educational Television and Unesco
results.brief_description: An examination of the policy of apartheid and the history of white domination in South Africa. While the native population maintains the country’s booming economy by providing a cheap labour force, the white population exercise strict control over every facet of native life and have created what is virtually a slave population.
results.creator_credit_for_label: British Broadcasting Corporation, National Educational Television and Unesco

results.title: The Twentieth
results.brief_description: A record of the Twentieth Jazz Convention held in Sydney from December 26th to 31st, 1966. The main site of the convention was the Railways Institute but some bayside hotels, including the Coogee Bay Hotel, also became part of the scene. Includes some interesting shots of old inner Sydney streetscapes as well as the Opera House under construction. The first Jazz Convention was held in 1946 in Melbourne and features traditional jazz and blues music - 79 bands registered for this 20th convention. Performers included Graeme Bell, Nick Politis, Eric Richards, and the Original Australian Washboard Wackers. A must for lovers of jazz. Photography: Tom Cowan, Nigel Buesst.

results.title: TV ads: our mini myths
results.creator_credit: Stanford Summers, Clio Enterprise and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Eleven prize-winning television commercials, grouped according to their persuasive intent, provide an entertaining and informative look into the business of advertising. From automobiles to insurance, from cameras to cologne, these vignettes illustrate the manner in which products are promoted all over the world. With no narration other than that contained in the commercials, each segment speaks for itself. Through imaginative animation and creative dramatisation, these messages accomplish their purpose by entertaining, educating, informing, using seductive overtones, etc. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Turkey: a strategic land and it's people
results.brief_description: The location of Turkey between Asia and Europe and astride Russia’s water route to the Black Sea gives it a strategic political importance. Shows the climatic and geographical features, natural resources and industries in relation to the Turkish people, the beginnings of westernisation as introduced by Ataturk and the continuing changes taking place in modern Turkey.

results.title: Turkey: nation in transition
results.creator_credit: Leroy Leatherman, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Introductory animation reviews the history of Turkey and the Middle East from earliest civilization to the twentieth century. Documentary footage shows life in Turkey today, its political and economic problems and its development as a modern nation with democratic institutions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leroy Leatherman, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: The Turbulent ocean
results.creator_credit: Bert Shapiro and MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology)
results.brief_description: A documentary film about oceanography - trying to determine theoretical eddies, to predict turbulence and ocean storms. Also an ocean-going research study to find a mode-eddy - which they did.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Shapiro and MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology)

results.title: Tullamarine: Melbourne airport
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell, Ivan Gaal and AVEC Film
results.brief_description: About the operational and sociological role of a modern airport in the life of people who pass through it and work in it. Follows the arrival of Qantas flight QF2 and departure QF1. Non-narrated.

results.title: Tuktu and the snow palace
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
After a trek to new hunting grounds, Tuktu’s family and friends build igloos, in particular a giant igloo where feasting, dancing and games take place. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
